ah, really have no clue personally how to debug this, only thing i can suggest as a stab in the dark is start up with noapic or noacpi kernel parameters
turning off apic and or acpi can help fix issues where the acpi or apic implementation is broken or buggy for your hardware
dont add it in grub in case your system doesnt boot afterwards
off top of my head procedure is keep tapping escape as your machine boots, in the grub menu press e then use the arrow keys to get to the end of the kernel line type noacpi then press enter or b
